clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Psychotherapeutic Intervention Model in Nursing
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Psychotherapeutic Intervention Model in Nursing: A Pilot Randomised Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effectiveness of a psychotherapeutic intervention model in nursing for the nursing diagnosis "Anxiety". A pilot randomised controlled trial will be carried out to testing procedures for their acceptability, estimating the likely rates of recruitment and retention of subjects, and the calculation of appropriate sample sizes. Moreover, this pilot study aims to test hypotheses.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effectiveness of a psychotherapeutic intervention model in nursing regarding nursing diagnosis "Anxiety" (according to International Classification for Nursing Practice (ICNP)/North American Nursing Diagnoses Association (NANDA) standardized nursing language). A pilot randomised controlled trial will be carried out to testing procedures for their acceptability, estimating the likely rates of recruitment and retention of subjects, and the calculation of appropriate sample sizes. Moreover, this pilot study aims to test hypotheses. In a double-blinded nurse-led 4 months controlled trial, conducted at a hospital outpatient setting in Portugal, 60 patients with anxiety will be randomised to the intervention (n=30) or control groups (n=30). The objective is to compare the outcomes associated with "treatment as usual" and the benefits of implementing the psychotherapeutic intervention model in nursing previously developed (5 sessions), which will be evaluated using Nursing Outcomes Classification (NOC) outcomes "Anxiety Level" and "Anxiety Self-Control" (Portuguese version).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the Level of Anxiety (NOC outcomes "Anxiety Level" and "Anxiety Self-Control" - Portuguese version)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the study (Session 0) and one week after session 5 (approximately 6 weeks after the beginning of the study)

arm_group.description: People diagnosed with "Anxiety" (according to ICNP/NANDA standardized nursing language) will be treated using Nursing Interventions Classification (NIC) psychotherapeutic intervention(s) for anxiety (plus psychopharmaceuticals).
People diagnosed with "Anxiety" (according to ICNP/NANDA standardized nursing language) will receive treatment as usual for anxiety (psychopharmaceuticals).

intervention.description: Patients will be treated by NIC psychotherapeutic intervention(s) for anxiety (e.g. anxiety reduction) plus psychopharmaceuticals prescribed by their psychiatrist.

intervention.intervention_name: Psychopharmaceuticals (any drugs prescribed by the psychiatrist)
intervention.description: Patients will be treated only by psychopharmaceuticals prescribed by their psychiatrist.
